unknown_responses.rationale: Discusses potential future use of PrEP ('women could use event-driven PrEP') related to treatment/prevention capability.
Describes the intended outcome/purpose of PrEP ('could have safe sex') which relates to its capability, without authorial reassurance.
Describes an ongoing action ('working on a new refresh of our strategic plan') as preparedness/planning.
Describes a plan/system ('living document', 'refreshed annually', 'individual pages') without calming keywords.
Asks a question about metrics ('What are the metrics') which are part of a system/plan.
Expresses a hope for future realization of interventions ('see the promise of the malaria interventions realized') as capabilities.
Describes interventions ('monoclonal antibodies', 'new vaccine') and their effect ('actually reduced malaria') as capabilities/treatments.
Describes a past achievement, not current capability/preparedness.
Mentions ongoing work and a study of an experimental vaccine ('study of the experimental vaccine M72') as development/research capability.
Expresses hope for future progress ('make some inroads') and mentions seeing what happens (future possibility).
Expresses a personal feeling/opinion, not capability/preparedness.
Describes a future goal ('aim for some incredible game-changing interventions') related to development capability.
